maml:description.maml:para: Gets the details of a single Event Hub, or gets a list of Event Hubs.

The Get-AzureRmEventHub cmdlet returns either the details of an Event Hub, or a list of all Event Hubs in the current namespace. If the Event Hub name is provided, the details of a single Event Hub are returned. If an Event Hub name is not provided, a list of all Event Hubs in the specified namespace is returned.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHub -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the details of the Event Hub `EventHubName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHub -ResourceGroup MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns a list of Event Hubs in the namespace `MyNamespaceName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the details of an authorization rule, or gets a list of authorization rules.

The Get-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule cmdlet gets either the details of an authorization rule, or a list of all authorization rules for a specified Event Hub. If the name of an authorization rule is provided, the details of that single authorization rule are returned. If the name of an authorization rule is not provided, a list of all authorization rules for the specified Event Hub is returned.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName -AuthorizationRule MyAuthRuleName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName` in the Event Hub `MyEventHubName`, which is scoped by the namespace `MyNamespaceName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets a list of all authorization rules in the Event Hub `MyEventHubName`, which is scoped by the namespace `MyNamespaceName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the details of a specified Event Hubs consumer group, or gets a list of consumer groups in an Event Hub.

The Get-AzureRmEventHubConsumerGroup cmdlet gets either the details of a specified Event Hubs consumer group, or a list of consumer groups in a given Event Hub. If the name of a consumer group is provided, the details of a single consumer group details are returned. If the name of a consumer group is not provided, a list of consumer groups in the specified Event Hub is returned.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubConsumerGroup -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName -ConsumerGroupName MyConsumerGroupName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the consumer group `MyConsumerGroupName` in the Event Hub `MyEventHubName`, which exists in the namespace `MyNamespaceName` with resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubConsumerGroup -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets a list of consumer groups in the Event Hub `MyEventHubName`, which exists in the namespace `MyNamespaceName` with resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the primary key details of the specified Event Hubs authorization rule.
The Get-AzureRmEventHubKey cmdlet returns the primary key details of the specified Event Hubs authorization rule.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubKey -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName -AuthorizationRuleName MyAuthRuleName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets details of the primary key for the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the details of an Event Hubs namespace, or gets a list of all Event Hubs namespaces in the current Azure subscription.

The Get-AzureRmEventHubNamespace cmdlet gets either the details of a specified Event Hubs namespace, or a list of all Event Hubs namespaces in the current Azure subscription. If the namespace name is provided, the details of a single Event Hubs namespace is returned. If the namespace name is not provided, a list of namespaces is returned.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubNamespace -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the details of the Event Hubs namespace `MyNamespaceName` in the resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the details of an Event Hubs namespace authorization rule, or gets a list of authorization rules.

The Get-AzureRmEventHubNamespaceAuthorizationRule cmdlet gets either the details of a specified Event Hubs namespace authorization rule, or a list of namespace authorization rules. If the authorization rule name is provided, the details of a single authorization rule is returned. If an authorization rule name is not provided, a list of all authorization rules in the namespace is returned.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Event Hubs namespace authorization rule name.
The Event Hubs namespace authorization rule name.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubNamespaceAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -AuthorizationRuleName MyAuthRuleName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName` in the Event Hubs namespace `MyNamespaceName`, with the resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubNamespaceAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -AuthorizationRuleName RootManageSharedAccessKey

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the default authorization rule `RootManageSharedAccessKey` in the Event Hubs namespace `MyNamespaceName`, with the resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubNamespaceAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all authorization rules in the Event Hubs namespace `MyNamespaceName`, with the resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the primary key details of the specified Event Hubs namespace authorization rule.
The Get-AzureRmEventHubNamespaceKey cmdlet returns the primary key details of the specified authorization rule in the given Event Hubs namespace.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the authorization rule on the Event Hubs namespace.
The name of the authorization rule on the Event Hubs namespace.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmEventHubNamespaceKey -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -AuthorizationRuleName MyAuthRuleName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets details of the primary key for the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName` on the Event Hubs namespace `MyNamespaceName` in the resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Event Hub.
The New-AzureRmEventHub cmdlet creates a new Azure Event Hub.

maml:Description.maml:para: Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Event Hubs message retention time in days.
Number of partitions in the Event Hub.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Event Hubs message retention time in days.
Number of partitions in the Event Hub.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventHubNamespace -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -Location WestUS -EventHubName MyEventHubName -MessageRetentionInDays 3 -PartitionCount 2

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates an Event Hub named `MyEventHubName` with a 3-day message retention period and two partitions, in the `WestUS` location, with resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Event Hubs authorization rule.
The New-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule cmdlet creates a new Event Hubs authorization rule.

maml:Description.maml:para: Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName -AuthorizationRuleName MyAuthRuleName -Rights @("Listen","Send")

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates an authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName` granting Listen and Send rights to the Event Hub `MyEventHubName` in namespace `MyNamespaceName`, with resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new consumer group for the specified Event Hub.
The New-AzureRmEventHubConsumerGroup cmdlet creates a new consumer group for the specified Event Hub.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventHubConsumerGroup -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName -ConsumerGroupName MyConsumerGroupName

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates the consumer group `MyConsumerGroupName` in the Event Hub `MyEventHubName`, scoped to the namespace `MyNamespaceName`, with resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new primary or secondary key for the specified Event Hubs authorization rule.
The New-AzureRmEventHubKey cmdlet regenerates the primary or secondary SAS key for the specified Event Hubs authorization rule.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the resource group.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventHubKey -ResourceGroup MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName -AuthorizationRuleName MyAuthRuleName -RegenerateKey PrimaryKey

dev:remarks.maml:para: Regenerates the primary key for the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventHubKey -ResourceGroup MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName -AuthorizationRuleName MyAuthRuleName -RegenerateKey SecondaryKey

dev:remarks.maml:para: Regenerates the secondary key for the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an Event Hubs namespace.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzureRmEventHubNamespace -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -Location MyLocation

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates an Event Hubs namespace `MyNamespaceName` in the specified geographic location `MyLocation`, in resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Regenerates the primary key for the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName` in the Event Hubs namespace `MyNamespaceName`, with resource group `MyResourceGroupName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the specified Event Hub.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the Event Hub `MyEventHubName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the specified Event Hub authorization rule.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName` from the Event Hub `MyEventHubName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the specified Event Hub.
The Set-AzureRmEventHub cmdlet updates the properties of the specified Event Hub.

maml:Description.maml:para: Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Event Hub message retention period, in days.
Number of partitions on this Event Hub.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Event Hub message retention period, in days.
Number of partitions on this Event Hub.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-AzureRmEventHub -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName -EventHubObj MyCreatedEventHub -messageRetentionInDays 4 -partitionCount 2

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the Event Hub `MyEventHubName` represented by the `MyCreatedEventHub` object, setting the message retention period to 4 days, and the number of partitions to 2.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the specified authorization rule on an Event Hub.
The Set-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule cmdlet updates the specified authorization rule on the given Event Hub.

maml:Description.maml:para: Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Required if 'AuthruleObj' not specified. Rights; for example, @("Listen","Send","Manage")
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Required if 'AuthruleObj' not specified. Rights; for example, @("Listen","Send","Manage")

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-AzureRmEventHubAuthorizationRule -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName -AuthorizationRuleName MyAuthRuleName -Rights @("Manage")

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the authorization rule `MyAuthRuleName` to grant Manage rights to the Event Hub `MyEventHubName`, scoped by the namespace `MyNamespaceName`.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the specified Event Hubs consumer group.
The Set-AzureRmEventHubConsumerGroup cmdlet updates the specified Event Hubs consumer group.

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-AzureRmEventHubConsumerGroup -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -EventHubName MyEventHubName -ConsumerGroupName MyConsumerGroupName -UserMetadata "Testing"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the user metadata of the consumer group `MyConsumerGroupName` to "Testing."

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the specified Event Hubs namespace.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-AzureRmEventHubNamespace -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroupName -NamespaceName MyNamespaceName -Location "WestUS" -State Created

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the state of namespace `MyNamespaceName` to Created .
